intro: Warszewiczia uxpanapensis subsp. uxpanapensis, commonly known as the Mexican thorn tree, is a shrub or small tree native to Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and thorny branches. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by pod-like fruits containing seeds. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in dry regions. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems and a subject of ecological study.
